title: Annotation sessions/projects
body:
As a manager I want to be able to setup specific annotation sessions or projects so that I can distribute the annotation work to several annotators.

This is related to having Dataset "views" which can be defined using filters and the query DSL and created so that team members can share and work on specific dataset slices or subsets. If I can create a view and assign it to different users, this could be a way to have annotation projects.

As a pre-requisite we need to have User permissions and roles

title: Similarity search with vectors

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

body:
In order to enable similarity and vector search features (bulk labeling, similarity-based data curation, etc.) the first step is to enable the ability to store a vector associated with a record.

The main idea is to enable users to embed a record (using their embedding method of choice) and then add the vector as a field associated with the record. In this way, it can already be used with ES/Opensearch for KNN as well as for other use cases.

There are some things to take into account:

- Compat between Opensearch and Elasticsearch
- Work needs to be done at the Server and the Client level

We already started working on this: https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/pull/214 but stopped because Elasticsearch's support was limited at the time.

There are several discussions around this topic:
https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/discussions/177
https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/discussions/1079


## Tasks
- [x] #2026
- [x] #2027 
- [x] #2028 
- [x] #2029

title: Visual Query Builder

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: area: ux
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Experience (UX)

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body:
As a UI user I want to have support for defining complex queries for data labelling.



Develop a functional component for helping users to write complex query conditions. The suggested shape of the component is an input field with typeahead (or autocomplete) that assists the users to query a hypothetic search endpoint.

The main idea is to build a visual component to help users to create query conditions. Some examples of queries could be:

    username == "john" AND (age < 20 OR age > 60)
    NOT (company == "Google" OR code == 30)

title: Dataset settings
body:
## Description

Allow configure dataset level settings for several purposes:

- Edit the labels (add, edit, remove) ( refs #1887 )
- Define metadata fields schema. This could include hidden fields, for example
- Customize the inner elaticsearch index settings/mappings (for advanced users)
- Configure the users that can operate over the dataset (annotators, administrators, reviewers,...). Here, a previous design for user roles should be defined.
- Some task could define their own settings (the `multi_label` parameter could be a setting for the text classification task)

### From issue #1853 
Edit the tags and workspace for the dataset, but only was able to do so via deletion and re-creation.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The possibility to have a button next o the delete and copy that allows for editting.

title: Dataset cards and metadata generation for Hub

labels.name: type: integration
labels.description: Indicates integrations with third parties

body: ## Resources - The HF dataset card creator app: https://huggingface.co/datasets/card-creator/ - The HF dataset card template: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/huggingface/datasets/master/templates/README.md ## Description The HF dataset card contains a set of fields we will easily expose when publishing an RB dataset into the HF hub. As a starting point, we can provide tools for: - manual configuring some dataset tags (task, task category, language,...) - automatic configuring tag like size - manual a dataset summary/description - automatically generate a basic dataset structure - all RB datasets should keep the same general schema. please @dvsrepo @dcfidalgo confirm the issue spec.

title: Token classification weak labelling

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: area: ux
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Experience (UX)

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body:
As in the text classification task, the **"Weak labeling"** mode in token classification must allow tag entities by defining a query and entity label (the rule).

Given a rule, the **Weak labeling** mode for token classification will tag entities based on the matched tokens/words in the search results returned by the API.

The way the entity will be tagged from the matched token will be determined by a **labeling function** provided as an attribute of the rule. For now, just one single labeling function will be supported, the `exact_match`, where all matched tokens/words will be tagged as the provided rule.

For example, given a labeling rule with the query `Par*`, the label `PLACE`, and the matched record `Paris is the city of light`, the labeling function will tag the token `Paris` as a `PLACE`.

An important behavior of this feature is to provide a visualization of the tagged entities in the visible records from the UI.

title: Improve weak labelling workflow in the UI

labels.name: area: python sdk
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Python SDK

body:
As a user I want to be able to use the results of my rules for directly labeling the records.

Improving this can be done in several ways:

- Using a lightweight label model or MajorityVote and then applying its predictions (as annotation or prediction)

- Materializing the explicit weak labels in the record (which can be problematic in terms of UX with more than 50 rules)

title: prediction agent per prediction in the same log.

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I am working with the retrieval of token classifications from different sources (prediction_agents). I evaluate and choose the best predictions for each of these sources and want to log them, but I can only pass a single prediction agent for the entire list of predictions.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to provide a list of prediction agents, where each agent would be assigned to their corresponding prediction within the same log.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I have considered duplicating the logs for each agent, but this created duplicate entries and doesn't allow me to monitor the co bined result of my NER token classifications. 

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: Histogram of prediction score does not correspond to the sliders

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the web app for a text classification dataset, the histogram of the prediction score filter does not correspond to the sliders.
This is a bit confusing when trying to adjust the sliders. 

**To Reproduce**
Do the first tutorial, try to use the slider to find predictions with low scores.

**Expected behavior**
The histogram should be aligned with the sliders.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2022-03-01 11-47-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15979778/156155688-31a66f0e-e8b7-40f4-afed-a906b745b502.png)

In the screenshot, the x-axis of the histogram starts at 50%, but the sliders start at 0% 

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: master
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.10.2

title: httpx 422 error when using wrong characters in 'name' during 'rb.log()' within FastAPI

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
httpx 422 error when using wrong characters in 'name' during 'rb.log()' within FastAPI

**To Reproduce**
I came across a bug(?) when trying to set-up logging from within FastAPI with backgroundtasks. When calling the rb.log(), the name variable containing certain characters, it results in a HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity  error. It turn out, it was caused by using cased letters and some other characters like "." and "_". When outside FastAPI, I didn't have these issues.
`
rb.log(
    rb.TextClassificationRecord(inputs="My first Rubrix example"),
        name="Research--spacy-en-research",
        verbose=False
)
`

**Expected behavior**
Outside of FastAPI I do get to use the naming I want.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Windows 11
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: N.A. 
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.11
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: N.A.
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  N.A.
 - httpx = {version = "0.15.0", extras = ["http2"]}
- fastapi = "^0.70.0"
- uvicorn = "^0.15.0"

**Additional context**
HTTP Request: POST http://localhost:6900/api/datasets/Research--spacy-en-research/TextClassification:bulk "HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity"
HTTP Request: POST http://localhost:6900/api/datasets/research_spacy-en-research/TextClassification:bulk "HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity"
HTTP Request: POST http://localhost:6900/api/datasets/research.spacy-en-research/TextClassification:bulk "HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity"

title: [Workspaces] Shared or public datasets

labels.name: status: question
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request needs more information

body:
Do make sense to have a way to define public datasets when working with workspaces?

Those datasets shouldn't be a concrete workspace (or maybe a `public` one but not confortable with this (because of following reasons). 

A related question here is: what happens with datasets created by default installation setup after configure a `.users.yaml` file. Datasets created with default user (`rubrix`/`1234`) don't have a related workspace. Once we customize the users, those datasets are not visibles for defined users, at least you define a super-user. 

See also #1119

title: feat(#1192): disable ssl verify for elasticsearch http client
body:
This PR just allows disable http ssl client verification (for elasticsearch/opensearch connection) by setting the environment variable:

```bash
RUBRIX_ELASTICSEARCH_SSL_VERIFY=False
```

This is strongly discouraged for production environments, but can be used for quick testing of non-secure environments.

title: [Es connection] Allow disable ssl verification for elasticsearch connection
body:
It would be nice to disable ssl client verification for trusted environment where we can just do some test. 

A env var `RUBRIX_ELASTICSEARH_SSL_VERIFY` could be used for that purpose.

I uploaded the one for spaCy. I will update pictures in a different commit.

title: feat(#1144): weak multi labels
body:
This PR addresses part of #1144 and implements a weak label matrix for multi-label text classification datasets.
It introduces a new `WeakMultiLabels` class that stores the weak labels as a 3 dim matrix (nr of records x nr of rules x nr of labels) with values of -1 (abstentions), 0 (no vote), and 1 (vote). The annotations are stored in a 2 dim matrix (nr of records x nr of labels). @frascuchon let's have a meeting and check that the metrics of the `WeakMultiLabels.summary` method and the ones in the UI/Server are aligned.

The `WeakLabels` and `WeakMultiLabels` classes share a common base class that facilitates the specific implementations and avoids code duplication.

The next step would be to make the label models compatible with this new weak label class.

title: [ClientRecords] Record id's not decisive
body:
This will log only the second record
```python
records = [
    rb.TextClassificationRecord(inputs="mock", id=1),
    rb.TextClassificationRecord(inputs="mock", id="1")
]
rb.log(records, "test")
```

Not sure what to do here, or if it is even an issue. One solution could be to restrict the id type to str as we had before, but then we will lose the functionality of ordering the records with `enumerate`.

cc @dvsrepo @frascuchon

title: feat(#1130): Cleanup rb namespace by refactoring client API
body:
Closes #1130 

This is a proposal for how to clean up the `rb` namespace when we do `import rubrix as rb`:
- made `RubrixClient` a module, I named it `api.py` since it's basically the API if you want to interact with the server, but naming suggestions are welcome
- moved the few functionalities that were in the `rubrix.__init__.py` to this module
- `rubrix.__init__.py` just imports stuff that it wants to expose to the user, so it's the user-facing API

title: [TextClassification] Logged predictions are not shown in Annotate mode

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
The logged predictions do not show up in annotate mode for textclassification records.

**To Reproduce**
```python
import rubrix as rb

records = []
for example in to_label1.shuffle():
    record = rb.TextClassificationRecord(
        inputs=example["text"],
        metadata={'category': example['label']}, # log the intents for exploration of specific intents
        prediction=[(pred['label'], pred['score']) for pred in example['predictions']],
        prediction_agent="distilbert-base-uncased-finetuned-sst-2-english"
    )
    records.append(record)
    
rb.log(name='labeling_with_pretrained', records=records)
```
Basically the first part of our first tutorial.

**Expected behavior**
Predictions should show up in annotate mode.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2022-02-15 11-35-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15979778/154045112-634dd899-e97c-4cf6-9222-e2dcd1441492.png)

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.10.0 and master
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.10.2
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  

**Additional context**

title: feat(#1029): improve server api logging
body:
This PR improves the server api logging by using [loguru](https://github.com/Delgan/loguru).  If loguru package is not installed, the "basic" logging will be used.

In future PRs we can customize or parameterize some aspects of new logging engine.


The logging traces looks like that:
````bash
2022-02-14 13:18:01.905 | INFO     | uvicorn.lifespan.on:startup:59 - Application startup complete.
2022-02-14 13:18:01.906 | INFO     | uvicorn.server:_log_started_message:206 - Uvicorn running on http://0.0.0.0:6900 (Press CTRL+C to quit)
2022-02-14 13:18:06.438 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57502 - "GET /api/me HTTP/1.1" 200
2022-02-14 13:18:07.386 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57502 - "GET /api/datasets/ HTTP/1.1" 200
/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/opensearchpy/connection/base.py:208: OpenSearchWarning: Loading the fielddata on the _id field is deprecated and will be removed in future versions. If you require sorting or aggregating on this field you should also include the id in the body of your documents, and map this field as a keyword field that has [doc_values] enabled
  warnings.warn(message, category=OpenSearchWarning)
2022-02-14 13:18:10.220 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57502 - "POST /api/datasets/test_some_sort/TokenClassification%3Asearch?limit=5&from=0 HTTP/1.1" 200
2022-02-14 13:18:10.296 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57502 - "POST /api/datasets/test_some_sort/TokenClassification%3Asearch?limit=0&from=0 HTTP/1.1" 200
2022-02-14 13:18:17.091 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57503 - "GET /api/datasets/ HTTP/1.1" 200
2022-02-14 13:18:18.958 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57503 - "POST /api/datasets/test_multiple_mentions_in_same_record/TokenClassification%3Asearch?limit=5&from=0 HTTP/1.1" 200
2022-02-14 13:18:19.027 | INFO     | uvicorn.protocols.http.httptools_impl:send:432 - 127.0.0.1:57503 - "POST /api/datasets/test_multiple_mentions_in_same_record/TokenClassification%3Asearch?limit=0&from=0 HTTP/1.1" 200
````

Closes #1029

title: fix(#1140): fix/make client models more consistent
body:
Closes #1140 

This PR fixes/improves a bit the `score` handling in the `TokenClassificationRecord` and `Text2TextRecord`. This enables the support of "entity scores" in the `DatasetForTokenClassification`.

Also includes some more testing.

title: docs(#1131): Update issue templates
body: Closes #1131

title: feat(#1127): raise startup app error from es connection error
body:
By raising the error with `from` clause, you can separate errors details from the main error message. You will see an error like:

```bash
opensearchpy.exceptions.ConnectionTimeout: ConnectionTimeout caused by - ReadTimeoutError(HTTPConnectionPool(host='localhost', port=9200): Read timed out. (read timeout=10))

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 526, in lifespan
    async for item in self.lifespan_context(app):
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 467, in default_lifespan
    await self.startup()
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 502, in startup
    await handler()
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rubrix/server/server.py", line 101, in configure_elasticsearch
    raise ConfigError(
pydantic.errors.ConfigError: Your Elasticsearch endpoint at http://localhost:9200 is not available or not responding.
Please make sure your Elasticsearch instance is launched and correctly running and
you have the necessary access permissions. Once you have verified this, restart the Rubrix server.
```

Closes #1127

title: [Client] Improve TokenClassification and Text2Text models
body:
I want to make two small changes to the `TokenClassificationRecord` and `Text2TextRecord`:
- automatically add the default entity score of 1.0 when not provided in the predictions (TokenClassification)
- allow unlikely but allowed text2text records, that have a mix of tuples (text, score) and only text predictions

body: This PR excludes ipynb files from the end-of-file-fixer pre-commit hook, which gave me a lot of headaches when working with notebooks in pycharm.

title: fix: index records when logging
body: Wraps properly the index not found exception that cause the logging fails.

title: [Monitoring] Introduce a more general async log

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Some users find `rb.monitor` very useful because it's async and they wonder if it would be possible to have a more general-purpose `rb.log` which is async too for dealing with custom cases and pipelines.


A specific use case where rb.monitor is not flexible enough (which might raise some enhancement ideas too):

User has a single pipeline/model which receives data from different "customers" and wants to log the predictions into different datasets something like `nlp(data, rubrix_dataset=f"{customer_name}_dataset")` 

In any case if feasible I think an async version of log makes total sense 

What do you think @frascuchon ?

title: [Community] Add ISSUE templates: feature, request, bug report, etc.

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

title: [Client] Clean up the rubrix namespace
body:
I think it would be nice to have a cleaner namespace when importing rubrix.
When we do `import rubrix as rb` in jupyter, an `rb.<tab>` will show you a lot of stuff since we do all kinds of imports in the __init__.py that are not really meant for the end-user.

title: docs(#1128): Add video to skweak tutorial
body: Closes #1128

title: [docs] Add video to skweak tutorial
[Server start] Improve message when elastic not launched/available
body:
Currently we see this:

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 526, in lifespan
    async for item in self.lifespan_context(app):
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 467, in default_lifespan
    await self.startup()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 502, in startup
    await handler()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rubrix/server/server.py", line 101, in configure_elasticsearch
    raise ConfigError(
pydantic.errors.ConfigError: Your Elasticsearch endpoint at http://localhost:9200 is not available or not responding.
Please make sure your Elasticsearch instance is launched and correctly running and you have the necessary access permissions. Once you have verified this, restart the Rubrix server.
Error detail: [ConnectionError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x16fc94610>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 61] Connection refused) caused by: NewConnectionError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x16fc94610>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 61] Connection refused)]
```

For improving readability I'd recommend removing the Error detail as it does not add anything meaningful and makes the clear message more difficult to read.

 Is this possible?

title: Feat/advanced query dsl mode
body:
This PR includes an advanced query dsl model that uses an [enhanced lucene query dsl sintax ](https://github.com/jurismarches/luqum) to enable queries with nested fields, for example.

This "advanced mode" is enabled by a query body parameter for the sake of the compatibility. This is not enabled for weak labels rules for now, until a feature validation.

You can test this feat from UI app by setting the `advancedQueryDsl` query parameter manually

The advanced query dsl will resolve requirements mentioned in recognai/roadmap#55

title: refactor(#945): add current search aggregations as metrics
body:
This PR define missing current aggregation in search as dataset metrics. For example we can find `predicted_as` or `annotated_by` as a metric for token classification datasets.

This is a part of work for better search model interaction
